definition: Overall satisfaction and emotional tone expressed by customer during and after call interaction, including sentiment scores, trends, and distribution
Date ranges, time periods, and temporal analysis for tracking changes over time (monthly, quarterly, yearly trends, specific date ranges)
Why customer called - includes all levels of call drivers (L1, L2, L3), primary intent, secondary intent, call reason, and customer need
Call transfers between departments, transfer sequences, departments involved, and transfer patterns
Calls escalated to supervisors, supervisor involvement, escalation patterns and reasons
Total call time, handle time, talk time, hold time, and time-related call metrics
Agent-level performance metrics including sentiment scores, resolution rates, handle time, and improvement trends
How call was resolved, including resolution status, callbacks promised, support tickets created, and issue resolution
Main topics discussed during call, primary subjects, customer issues, and problem categories
Customer classification including prepaid/postpaid, first-time/repeat callers, customer segments, and account types
Number of calls, call counts, call distribution, and volume analysis
Geographic analysis including regions, markets, locations, cities, and states
Call disconnection events, disconnect rates, and reasons for disconnection
Billing issues, charges, payments, invoices, and billing-related concerns
Customer disconnects, voluntary/involuntary churn, retention attempts, and churn analysis
Interactive Voice Response system usage, IVR calls, self-service attempts, and IVR session data
Price plans, service plans, plan types, and customer plan information
Call center departments, business units, skill groups, and organizational units handling calls
Customer IDs, phone numbers, account numbers, and customer identifiers
Customer devices, phone models, equipment types, device issues, and hardware-related information
Network coverage, service outages, connectivity issues, network performance, and technical service problems
Customer account transactions including activations, deactivations, plan changes, line adds/removes, and account modifications
Revenue, average revenue per user, financial performance, costs, and monetary metrics
Customer age, tenure, generation, demographics, and profile characteristics
Retention offers, promotions, discounts, offers made to customers, and offer acceptance/rejection
Raw text transcript and metadata of the customer-agent interaction
Details of the customer's interaction with the Interactive Voice Response system
Reference data for call center sites, locations, and configuration
Technical specifications and capabilities of mobile devices and equipment
Tracking of retention tools and offers presented by agents during calls
Analytical insights derived from loyalty and retention calls
Specifics of retention offers made to customers and their acceptance status
